intro: Senecio hollickii, commonly known as Hollick's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Senecio hollickii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
